qas.question: Who is Obama possibly an ancestor of?

answers.text: the first African slave in the Virginia colony

qas.question: Why was he indentured for life?

answers.text: they were born to free English women

context: In July 2012, Ancestry.com reported on historic and DNA research by its staff that discovered that Obama is likely a descendant through his mother of <a0_0>John Punch<a0_0/>, considered by some historians to be <a1_0>the first African slave in the Virginia colony<a1_0/>. An indentured servant, he was "bound for life" in <a2_0>1640<a2_0/> after <a3_0>trying to escape<a3_0/>. The story of him and his descendants is that of multi-racial America since it appeared he and his sons married or had unions with white women, likely indentured servants and working-class like them. Their multi-racial children were free because <a4_0>they were born to free English women<a4_0/>. Over time, Obama's line of the Bunch family (as they became known) were property owners and continued to "marry white"; they became part of white society, likely by the early to mid-18th century.
